intro: Oenanthe pimpinelloides subsp. callosa, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
